Shipping Progress
As of today 90% of the books have been delivered. I continue to keep tabs on the shipments which have not been delivered, but there is very little Postnord can do from here. Often times it is easier for you to get information about your shipment directly thru your local post office, like USPS in the US.

Shipping Progress
Today I have sent out a status email with tracking info to those of you who still have not received your shipment.
The project in numbers

We have shipped all the physical rewards!
Yesterday the final batch of books was shipped and me and my dad can now relax for a bit and celebrate! Thank you all for your encouraging messages and for sticking around until the end!
There is still some work to do...

Shipping Progress
Today we sent out the biggest batch of books yet and with that we have managed to ship 80% of all physical rewards.

Shipping Progress
By tomorrow we should reach the half way point of physical rewards shipped. The current velocity indicate that it will take 2 more weeks to get all of the books shipped. I had hoped to have reached 70%+ by now so I'm still not happy and trying to improve speed.

Shipping Progress
Some of you have received a shipping confirmation today! A bit over 24% of the physical rewards have been shipped and more are being prepared.

Today you may have received something called a "Commercial Invoice" from me (and the rest of you will receive yours in the coming days). This has sparked a lot of questions so let me try to address them all in one place:
Do I need to reply if I do not find anything wrong?

Shipping will resume next week!
Good news! The tax agency approved my VAT application so this weekend I am able to resume the preparations of the shipping and export documentation. The actual physical shipping will resume after the Easter weekend (Monday is a holiday here).

Another small update with a speck of progress!
4 weeks have passed since I hit the road block with the tax agency and while the issue is still unresolved, this week the status of my VAT application went from "received" to "in progress" which means that someone is actively looking into it! Hopefully the application will get approved soon so shipping can continue.

campaign.story:
ToeJam & Earl’s Funky Fresh Foods of Funkotron is a colorful, weird, and funky cookbook coming to you soon. This official cookbook draws inspiration from the classic ToeJam & Earl video game series as well as real world foods and flavors. You don't have to be a fan of the series to get behind this cookbook. Just like the game series it's based on, Funky Fresh Foods is designed for beginners and pros alike. You don't have to be familiar with the series to jump in and enjoy the recipes in this cookbook! There is something for everyone in this book. It's weird, it's alien, it's interesting! ☄️
Please don't ask me how they’re floating, I don't know. I just get paid to put the photos on the page.
Funky Fresh Foods of Funkotron tells the story of how the groovy extraterrestrial duo, ToeJam and Earl, embark on an epic quest from the Funkapotamus himself to bring new tastes, interstellar peace, and funky, fresh flavors to planet Earth. This cookbook is chock full of classic dishes re-imagined with a vibrant, otherworldly vibe. How about a funky beat cake made with real beets? Would you try some Tomato Jam and Earl Grey shortbread cookies (a specialty of Mama Flo)? Oh, maybe Big Earl will finally share the secret recipe behind his world famous hot dog! Sounds weird, looks weirder, but all tastes amazing. Funky Fresh Foods will teach you to prepare meals that will take your taste buds to the moon and back. 🚀
Fun recipes to try at home with friends and family.
Flamingo not included.
ToeJam & Earl is all about fun and trying out new things, just like our recipes! The series has always been about bringing people together and showing them new cultures and ideas with excitement, mystery, and imagination. This cookbook continues that tradition. We won't just show you new recipes, we'll also teach you a lot about how to cook and how much fun it can be. This isn't the first time we've made a cookbook either. Members of the team behind this cookbook have previously worked on two incredible culinary projects that were both major successes: Mother's Cookbook and The Legend's Cookbook. With all that experience and a brand new intergalactic setting, we’ll expand your mind and taste buds with far out dishes that will change the way you think about yourself, the universe, and food. 🛸
If you're not familiar with the ToeJam & Earl series, that's ok! We'll give you a super quick rundown. The series debuted on the SEGA Genesis / Mega Drive back in 1991 and was a cult hit with three more entries made since then. The newest game, ToeJam & Earl: Back in the Groove, released in 2019 on Steam, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One.  The games star intergalactic alien rappers, ToeJam (the red one) and Earl (the yellow one), who crash their ship on our planet. Not only do they make a mess, they also run around collecting the parts of their ship, getting into trouble, and eating everything they can get their hands on (even though sometimes they probably shouldn't eat that moldy bread). The gameplay is fun and fast-paced with an emphasis on randomly generated levels, a funk-inspired soundtrack, and a healthy dose of 90's nostalgia. You don't have to be a TJ&E fan to enjoy this cookbook, but if this cookbook has piqued your interest, check out the games. They're a lot of fun. 🙂


Now that we've covered the source material, we can talk about the book more! ToeJam & Earl’s Funky Fresh Foods of Funkotron will be available in digital, paperback, and hardcover formats so you can choose (I always opt for the hardcover because I always get too much butter on my fingers to use my tablet). The book will be 8" x 10" (20.3cm x 25.4cm) and contain over 100 pages of funktastic photos, art, and recipes. You'll find over 44 original recipes (with the possibility of more with stretch goals 😉). This is a quality-made book too, unlike certain spaceships. It’ll hold up to kitchen use with a strong smyth sewn binding, deliciously heavyweight internal paper stock (makes the pages sauce-resistant), and a hardy matte laminate cover to keep the stains away. 💪
Ok, I actually kind of want carpet with this pattern on it.
Food has been a longtime staple in all manner of video games. The ToeJam & Earl series is no exception to that. The dynamic duo have been running around and chowing down on all kinds of comfort food ever since the first game. As a kid, I always wondered what an alien's take on pizza or ice cream would be and now I finally have the opportunity to show everybody! I also figured aliens probably ate a little bit healthier than most Earthlings, part of being an advanced civilization and such. With that in mind, this cookbook will heavily feature healthy recipes and vegetarian options and won’t contain any recipes that have red meat (then what’s in Earl’s hot dog??? Guess you'll have to back it to find out.) Here's a link to seven sample recipes! Not to mention, the food in our cookbook looks absolutely out-of-this-world and we know you'll want to show it off on social media. Hopefully it'll inspire some of your friends to try out some of our nutritious nosh. That being said, we want you all to live long and prosper. 🖖
The book is full of bright art, funky designs, and more, just like the game!

Hi! My name is June Kirsch and I'll be your fresh chef today on this funky adventure of a cookbook. I have been cooking forever. I just love it. I went to the Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park, New York and graduated in 2016 with a degree in Culinary Arts and Applied Food Studies. Or, as I like to call, "How to Make Food and How to Make it Good". 
She's the best chef I've ever met, she's also the only chef... I don't get out much.
My philosophy about cooking has always been about bringing people together. Meals are best shared and sometimes even if you can't be in the same room as someone, you can share a recipe with them and be a part of their life. I was born in Kenya and spent most of my childhood moving all over the planet, but we always made a point to share our meals together. It brought us together no matter the distance.
I learned a lot about cooking from all of my travels and my experience in culinary school but the best place to learn how to cook is your own kitchen. ToeJam & Earl resonates with me because they came to a new place, tried different things, and went outside their comfort zone, and these are all things I'm hoping to bring to this cookbook! I'm happy to be your pilot and I hope we don't crash land, but even if we do, I'm sure we'll have a great time making all manner of Funky Fresh Foods!
Big Earl ain't afraid of cooking bacon without a shirt on.
We’ve been working on this cookbook for quite a while! We started cooking almost a year ago, coinciding with the release of ToeJam & Earl: Back in the Groove.  A few of them have been tweaked a little since then, but you should check out our awesomely funky cooking videos. 🎥
PLAY

PLAY

Our plan is to wrap up our taste testing and finalize our recipes. We’ve been at it a while so that’s nearly done. Then we finish up all our art and photos. Then we get the books printed and shipped out to all you hungry backers. 🥡
A little preview of what's in the book.
I'm quite partial to the Moldy Bread personally.
Yes, I own that many pairs of scissors. I do a lot of scrap-booking.
PLAY

Design and blurb on the back of the book not final!
So cute!
Safety scissorsnot guaranteed!
A little preview of what's inside! Except Riley, he's too cute, I just had to sneak him in.
We have a few unlockable recipes waiting for only the funkiest of funklords. We're talking, of course, about our new Community Challenges! Community Challenges are a fun way for you to join your fellow fans and unlock additional recipes just by posting on social media. You don't even have to back the project to participate. You can join in on the funk simply by making silly videos, submitting fan art, or following the project. Beating the Community Challenges will upgrade all versions of the cookbook and everyone will benefit! All the challenges are listed below. You don't have to do them all if you don't want to but if you do, make sure to tag them with our special hashtag #FunkifyMe so we can find your posts! 🤯
CLEARED!!!! Challenge #1 - Tweeter Tweeter Pumpkin Eater 🎃 - Retweet our Initial Launch Tweet! We've unlocked an additional recipes since our initial tweet has reached at 300 retweets! Here’s a link go that Tweet.
CLEARED!!!! Challenge #2 - I Just Wanna Draw for Lamont's Sake 🍖 - We've unlocked an additional recipe since 35 art pieces have been posted! 
Challenge #3 - HOT DOG! 🌭 - Recreate Big Earl's classic pose while holding a hot dog! Make sure to tag your post with #FunkifyMe. This will unlock a special recipe once 25 photos have been posted!
Submission from @ghostsockz. It is between two buns, it still counts.
Challenge #4 - Do the Funky Kitchen Dance 💃 - Come on everyone! Record yourself (or an embarrassed loved one) dancing in the kitchen! Everyone does it, especially while wearing socks on a slippery tile floor. Make sure to tag your post with #FunkifyMe. This will unlock a special recipe once 25 videos have been posted!
PLAY

CLEARED!!!! Challenge #5 - Sharing is Caring 🤝 - We've unlocked an additional recipe since 10 recipes have been made! Here's a link to some of the recipes we've shared so far. 
PLAY

Community Challenge Progress!
These challenges must be completed while the campaign is active to unlock the additional recipes for the book. Since these challenges depend on the number of people who participate, encourage others to join as well to get those numbers up!
Not only do we have Community Challenges that you can participate in at any time during our campaign, we also have Weekly Challenges that are only around for a week at a time! There's a new one each week, so make sure you participate before you lose the chance to. Weekly Challenges are great because they give you a chance to win prizes! Also, if you have a Weekly Challenge entry that falls under a Community Challenge category, the entry can be used to unlock those special recipes as well! It will pull double duty.
To enter, you'll have to Tweet at us @FunkyFreshBook on Twitter with your entry or post it in the Official ToeJam & Earl Discord. We'll be watching and we'll announce winners each Monday morning. This is a fun way to get cool prizes. 🏆
COMPLETED! Week 1 - Tuesday, Sept. 29 - Sunday, Oct. 4 - Draw Your Heart Out! 💗 - Top three entries are going to be sent a free sticker set on us and an original doodle drawing of ToeJam & Earl by series designer Greg Johnson.
COMPLETED! Week 2 - Monday, Oct. 5th - Sunday, Oct. 11 - Game 'N' Nosh 🥪 - Top two entries will be sent an enamel pin on us and our eternal respect for their fake cooking skills. 
COMPLETED! Week 3 - Monday, Oct. 12th - Sunday, Oct. 18th - Share-A-Care 🤗 -  Share a caring tale, top ten entries get a Steam code of ToeJam & Earl: Back in the Groove, a PDF copy ofYooka-Laylee and the Kracklestone comic(we've partnered with our friends at Dreamprism Press), and a PDF copy of The Legend's Cookbook (follow the Twitter).
Week 4 - Monday, Oct. 19th - Nov 6th - Whatev! 🤷 - Do whatever! We will accept (most) anything but here's some ideas to get you going. Dress up as Earl for Halloween. Make a pipecleaner ToeJam. Share with us your own TJ&E inspired recipe. Do some fan art. Dance in your kitchen! Tie rockets to your shoes! SING A SONG ABOUT PEABO!!!
Get Creative!
You can record a video, post a comment on our Kickstarter, tweet art at us, or email us at funkyfreshcookbook@gmail.com (we promise we won't share without your permission) if need be. JUST DO WHATEVER TO CELEBRATE TOEJAM & EARL! Entries will be judged based on relation to TJ&E, originality, creativity, and funkiness. The more funky, the better. Bonus points if you make a funk song.
Winners get announced Monday, Nov. 9th. Top entry gets a (gently used) copy of every game in the series, that's right: ToeJam & Earl, Panic on Funkotron, Mission to Earth, and Back in the Groove.

Every project has its risks but our funky alien friends are going to do their part to help minimize that, like actually checking the rear-view mirror this time. One of the major possible hurdles is publication delay, especially with the ongoing pandemic. We will do our best to keep our backers up-to-date with our social media and with backer updates. If you have any concerns or questions, feel free to reach us through Kickstarter, email, or social media. Also, want to mention that all our designs here are subject to change and are not final. We are going to do our best to keep it real and keep you in the know.

updates.update_userinfo: Letting You Know: Slight Delay! (We're Sorry!)
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone, we just wanna reach out and let you know that the books are going to be a little delayed. Our head chef June took an opportunity for her and her family to work in Africa on a humanitarian mission and we 100% support her in doing that.

This delay doesn't mean that we have to wait for her to get back or anything like that! In fact, all the recipe testing is already done! It just means that working with her to draft and finish the copy in the book will take a little longer than expected. Over the last month, she and her family had to pack up and prepare for a whole new life overseas. They applied for this opportunity over a year ago but were essentially put on hold because of the pandemic. They very recently got the approval with limited notice but they got there and are currently settling into their new routine in Africa!

So! We have finished our photography for the book! (Except for maybe one backer-submitted recipe but we'll get it soon!) We are so happy with all our recipes and photos, here's a little sneak peak of what's in store for you and your stomach.

Hey you Funky Friends!
The recipe-testing has finally come to a conclusion! (Mostly, we have a handful of stragglers but we're working through that.) I hope you're excited for some of the wild, colorful, creative, tasty, and funky (but in a good way) recipes we've concocted. I'm talking about Vanilla Rose Vinegar Sorbet, Rainbow Fog Tea, the Stupid Cupid Burger, and the Sushi Guy’s Special. This is just a taste and we got a bunch more. These recipes are definitely gonna change the way you think about food as a whole (but also in a good way).
Hey-o peanuts! Hope you and your's had a fantastic holiday seasons!

Hey all you funky peanuts, guess what? We successfully funded our Kickstarter campaign and now we can get down to business (and by business, I mean cooking). Sorry for the late update, we took a few days off to relax to tidy up stuff but we're back now to update all your beautiful backers on the project and what is to come!
First off, thank you all. This really came down to the wire and we barely made it but we are so happy that we did. Huge thanks to all that came to our finale live stream on Twitch and we hope you loved it. Also, major shout outs to our hosts, , , and (and TJ&E Community Manager Nap). They were the real heroes!
We are fully funded!

Good News Everyone!
We were getting down to the wire and looking at our options and that's when we found out that, due to COVID-19, Kickstarter now allows you to file for a one week extension. We put in our request and we got what we asked for!

Only 3 days left!
Now's the time to tell your friends, it's your last chance to help get this book made. If you already backed, there's still other ways you can contribute as well. We still have our Community Challenges! We have exactly 2 left to fulfill which can help add 2 more recipes to the cookbook!

We finally are ready to announce the winners for Weekly Challenge #3.
🤗 -   get a Steam code of a PDF copy of comic (we've partnered with our friends at ), and a PDF copy of (). We will be DMing out codes for all these downloadable goodies ASAP.

Hello all!

Just as a reminder, if you would like to wait for the corrected Rainbow Devil, Rainbow Fool, or Gold Hanged man please send me a direct message over Kickstarter before the end of today so I can add your name to the  list!

Hello All!
Hope you're having a wonderful Saturday ^^
Just a quick update, I asked the manu when they would have the rest of the pins out to us, and they said they'd be shipped on or before the 20th of this month!

Hello hello!
Just wanted to update you all with some photos of the pins!
We got about 40% of our order in before the manufacturer shut down for the lunar new year! ^^
We will not be sending anything out until we have all our pins (Most likely mid to late March) But wanted to show all of you some of the pins! :D

Some unfortunate news. I was contacted by the manufacturer and due to the rising cases of COVID they are sending employees home early and starting their Lunar New Year break early as well. I was previously told the pins would be sent out on time, but, now am being told they will not be sent out until March 10th. Factoring in then shipping time for overseas shipping we most likely will not be able to start sending out pins until late March/early April.

campaign.story:
Beginning in 2014, the Object Head Zine series was born during the height of when zines, independently printed artbooks, and collaborative art anthologies were beginning to take the shape of how we know them now. From a personal desire to make something for this somewhat incohesive, beautiful fandom, I (Louise Leung/ Potentialforart/ Izu) wanted to organize a fun project that people would be able to enjoy and provide a book that artists and others would be able to hold in their hands. It exists as a series that alternates between physical, curated books, and digital, all-inclusive books, giving the opportunity to be published to everyone and anyone who wants to be. Since our initial start, we've covered many themes: Food/Utensils, Spooky, Flora and Fungi, Superstitions, Science and Technology, and now Celestial Bodies. 
You can see the previous books on Gumroad by clicking this image!
The 2021 Edition of the Object Head Zine centers around Celestial Bodies: Space and Angels. This book is a collection of illustrations and comics produced by 51 different artists put together in a 6"x9", 144 pages, perfect bound, soft cover with a rainbow shimmer effect. Artists for the book are paid a base page rate of $100 CAD/$80 USD per page (depending on the currency exchange). I pay this amount out of pocket and as an independent artist with a full-time job, I wish I could afford more. With this Kickstarter, I would like to give the artists of this edition the opportunity to earn more per page. 
The following artists are featured in this edition of the Zine:
Potentialforart ✧ Derek Hetrick ✧ Blacklimes ✧ Cacoethic+Lenalis ✧ Inktrashing ✧ Louise Kay Uy ✧ Juliette GMM López ✧ Autumn Haynes ✧ Coey Kuhn ✧ CORVIDAY ✧ theHoleyness ✧ Kimberly Wang ✧ Nelnal ✧ Chan Chau ✧ Nicolas Ky ✧ Hannako Lambert ✧ CosmicSynapse ✧ Sfé R. Monster ✧ Christian Angel ✧ Nighto ✧ Alli White ✧ Jeong ✧ Mim ✧ cosmicloak ✧ Jaye Fabel ✧ Slitherbop ✧ twendytwo ✧ Lemonjuiceday ✧ Junelet ✧ Sintija "siins" Ukše ✧ Laura Lee ✧ Izzy ✧ The Artifex ✧ Cindy ✧ Dr.Jingles ✧ Zachary Jack ✧ Simon Zabaldo ✧ Cryptovolans ✧ Lonnie Garcia ✧ Espy ✧ Shania Fan ✧ Jenny Park ✧ Rainboopz ✧ Weiwei Xu ✧ scylla ✧ John gorillaprutt ✧ AKIRATA ✧ Caitlin Ono ✧ Anna Chen Campbell ✧ Yuko Takeoka
Not Final Artwork Order
 The primary goal of this Kickstarter is to provide a $50 CAD per page pay bump (unfortunately cannot balance out currency exchange rates with this KS, $50 CAD will be however much it will be in other currencies) and to pay for the shipping of the books and merchandise to patrons of the Kickstarter.
The plan is to earn $4000 for artist payment ($50 per page based upon varying page amounts for artists), $2000 for shipping the books and associated merch to customers, $1000 to accommodate for Kickstarter fees and credit card fees, and $2000 as a cushion fund in case any of the above turns out to be more expensive than initially estimated. 
Shipping will be handled by White Squirrel, a bulk distribution and online store management service located north of Seattle. Using this service, all packages will have a tracking number given to the customer when the products are ready to be delivered and should be overall cheaper to ship out to customers both domestic and internationally.
 White Squirrel is a USA based, small company that works alongside creators to help distribute their products to their customer base. Run by Andrea and Sasha, they will be responsible for making sure all packages have the correct merchandise and sending them out on a prompt schedule.  To date, they've successfully mailed out over 32,000 packages and have worked (and are currently working with) 60+ projects and 40 creators.
Since the main purpose of this Kickstarter is to earn more money for our artists, the stretch goals are made to reflect that:
$12650: Artists will receive another additional $25 pay increase, totallying $75 pay increase to their page rate.
$15000: Artists will receive another additional $50 pay increase, totaling $100 pay increase to their page rate. 
This timeline is approximate due to many uncertainties currently going on: global pandemic, political strife, delayed postal services. If everything went smoothly and there were only a few delays, this would be the ideal timeline:
 Early-Mid November: Start the Kickstarter, I will order the books and remaining, less time-sensitive merchandise when I have a good sense of the numbers needed to fulfill the KS order. 
 Late November/December: Kickstarter finishes funding, I will send out the artists' additional payment once the money is cleared with Kickstarter and the bank. I will use the remaining money for shipping products to White Squirrel. Hopefully, receive all the merchandise needed. 
  Mid December - January: Hopefully receive books, start drawing in them.
 February: Finish drawing in books. Send books and merchandise out to White Squirrel
 March: White Squirrel receives the books and merchandise and can start sorting and mailing things out. 
 Possibly Late March - Mid April: Everything is completed, leftover books will be sold at the Gumroad store
Again, this is the ideal timeline and everything is very much subject to unpredictable delays and unforeseen circumstances. We will notify everyone through updates should any issues arise but we're hoping we can stick to this schedule, the world permitting.
 Project Lead: Potentialforart/Louise Leung
 Kickstarter Manager: Mia "Hye" Mardikian
 Kickstarter Video Creator: Iris Jay
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my seventh year producing the Object Head Zine and I've made tens of other zines, both physically and digitally so I am well versed in reaching deadlines and foreseeing possible delays. However, due to the global climate we live in (closed borders, pandemic, political strife), there may be possible delays in the production of materials (separate from the Kickstarter timeline), and shipping to customers. I ask that you are patient with us as we produce the best possible product for you. Nevertheless, I'll provide updates on the status of the books should there be a need to.

The production of the book and associated merchandise is not dependent on this Kickstarter. Regardless if this Kickstarter is funded, the books and merchandise will be made and put up on sale on the Object Head Zine Gumroad, should this crowdfunding be unsuccessful. 

White Squirrel is our bulk shipping handler for this Kickstarter and so, all shipping questions will be relayed to them.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Story 
Liam is a student, apparently like every other, except… he's not! Don't try to get too close to him or you're going to get burned. See, Liam has a terrible secret he can't share with his friends until… a series of unfortunate events occur, shattering his world. Enter Nathanael: tall, charming, unexpected. He will soon take a great place in Liam's life. But dark forces are threatening the fate of multiple universes, more powerful than any of them could have ever imagined. Nothing will ever be the same. Wait. And who are the Twin Kings already?

Phil Briones can do it all!
You still don't know Phil? Time to catch up, folks! Though he's mostly known to American audiences as an artist, this is not his first rodeo as a writer and color artist.  Phil Briones has enjoyed a successful career in animation (at Disney, working on movies such as Tarzan, Hercules, The Emperor's New Groove or A Goofy Movie), before transitioning to comics, first in his home country, France, then in the United States.

                   His body of work includes: 
Some of Phil Briones' works for Disney, Soleil, Ankama, Marvel, DC or Humanoids.

IN THE USA
White Tiger (Marvel)
Captain America (Marvel)
X-Men (Marvel)
Iron Man vs Whiplash (Marvel)
American Son (Marvel)
Suicide Squad (DC)
Detective Comics (DC)
Katana (DC)
Aquaman Rebirth (DC)
Ignited (Humanoids)
 IN FRANCE 
La Geste des Chevaliers Dragon (Soleil)   
 Wanderers w/Chris Claremont (Soleil/Panini)     
Geek Agency (Ankama)
 7 Héros (Delcourt)
Vikings & Sirènes (Humanoides Associés) 
Now, with Twin Kings' Battle, Phil delivers his most ambitious and personal work to date. His first ever full creator owned series. And FairSquare Comics couldn't be prouder to partner with him for this project.  
Phil at work in his home studio


The real deal
Twin Kings's Battle is a sentimental queer multi-layered drama fueled by supernatural and mystical elements. A story inspired by the best Asian romance tales of all mediums (manga/manhwa, TV series, literature). Our heroes' larger than life adventures won't leave you stone cold. Just like in any traditional "boys love" or "bromance" stories, emotions are the seeds of this graphic novel. But thanks to the powerful expressive art of Phil Briones, these elements are taken to the next level! 
If you ever seen Chinese hit series The Untamed, you will absolutely LOVE Twin Kings' Battle. 

Wait… What if I'm not Queer? Can I still be interested?
AB-SO-LU-TELY! Love is Love. And Twin Kings' Battle is not a gay centric story. It's mainly a story about love, friendship and what's our place in this universe (also with cool Dragons, swords, magical mysteries and humor). Whether you're a member of the LGBTQ+ community or not, you can fully enjoy this story. Twin King Battle is first and foremost about love and friendship, feelings that all of us can connect to. You'll LOVE this graphic novel. Oh, and don't be afraid to bring tissue… We're not going to spoil you the end of the first volume, but it's intense. 
Characters. Characters. Characters.
What sets Twin Kings' Battle apart from other graphic novels is the special tender love and care Phil Briones put in the creation of the main characters. Let's introduce them to you:
Liam Peters is a shy boy who comes from the Other Realm. A place where Dragons and Wizards are ruling with an iron fist, where magic is science.  When our story opens, Liam lives in his own mind. He lives almost alone. His only two friends are Neal and Amy. Most of his time, Liam spends it playing an online game he mastered to perfection: Twin Kings' Battle. He's so good at it that it made him some kind of celebrity. He has enough money from tournaments to pay for all his expenses and tuition. What's this game all about? Liam feels connected to it like he was living it. 
Neal Tycoon is Liam's best friend. He's kinda insecure at times being short and looking younger than he is. He sees Liam as the big brother he never had, though they're the same age. Liam really like Neal too even though he's not always showing it. The fact that he also bears a strange ressemblance with Liam's dearly departed brother doesn't help…
Amy Stephenson is clueless about Liam's past life. Our hero has been living with the Stephensons for a while but a lot has been left unsaid between him and Amy. In fact, the two youngsters couldn't be more different. She's as much and extrovert as he is an introvert. She likes Liam but can't also help to think that him coming to her family changed everything, and not always for the better. In spite all that, they were able to create a unique bonding. Amy lights up the room when she arrives and Liam grew to love that about her. The two are also passionate about the Twin Kings' universe, although Amy is more attracted by the novels than the video games.  
Nathanael Binger just arrived in town and on the campus. He's rich, handsome, nice, in shape. Nathanael is the star of a web series that's hugely popular with teenagers . And on top of that, he's modeling. This guy has it all! (don't we hate that?). Befriend him and you'll have the impression that you're someone very important. He's never too far from Liam and you could tell that he's genuinely intrigued by this mysterious young man. He's sure Liam is living a double life and he wants to know everything about it! Friend or foe? White knight or manipulator? What if Nathanael and Liam hadn't been brought to the same campus by accident?

The Graphic Novel and the FairSquare Comics Experience
This graphic novel is unique. Phil is of course quite unique. But FairSquare Comics is a publisher unlike any other. We don't just publish comics and graphic novels for the sake of publishing them. Every book is special. Since the company was founded, in 2019, we committed to releasing graphic novels that wouldn't even been considered elsewhere. Graphic novels from under represented and overlooked creators: Immigrants (like Fabrice Sapolsky, the publisher/Editor). Other minorities like creators from the Noir Is the New Black anthology or co-editor TC Harris. Queer creators and many more! We call it "Comics For The Rest of Us". 
Sure, other publishers will promote diversity and that’s awesome (the more, the better). But at FairSquare Comics, it’s in our DNA. We offer competitive deals to our creators in which they keep 100% of their rights. They are also fairly compensated for their work because creating comics is not a hobby, it’s a real job!
By supporting our books such as One-Hit Wonder, Noir Is the New Black, Twin Kings’ Battle and all the incredible graphic novels to come, you’re not simply supporting talent. We believe that if we can all buy organic groceries and support fair trade, we can all support creators and their graphic novels!
Speaking of which, Twin Kings' Battle Vol. 1 will be a 144 pages premium graphic novel:  80 lbs matte interior stock, 130 lbs soft touch cover stock. Square bound and sent in a special protective sleeve to avoid damages. Yes, we care. 
Some of the packages include dust jacket variants. There will be four different dust variants: one from Phil Briones, one from Yanick Paquette, one from xxxxxxx (to be announced) and a retailer exclusive variant by Jim Cheung. How cool is that?

Some really cool rewards…

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with every project, there's a risk. And Kickstarter seems to be like the El Dorado right now. 
But even though our timelines are filled with outstanding successes in the crowdfunding department, let's not forget that Kickstarter is an "all or nothing" kind of deal. If we don't get to our initial goal, we get nothing. So please, support us. Pledge. Share. Be our cheerleader. We need you. 

Independent comics can't exist without YOU. Independent creators can't deliver the best stories without any kind of interference without you. Phil Briones, Fabrice Sapolsky and everyone at FairSquare Comics are committed to delivering the finest quality in comics by cutting the middlemen. 

Help us grow. We'll give back even stronger! Thank YOU.

updates.update_userinfo: ONE WEEK TO GO, WE CAN STILL DO IT!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, 
Only 8 days until our campaign is over and we have much to accomplish until we reach our goal! But we have faith and we hope you're going to help us by spreading the word or upping your pledge! 
Below you'll find the latest installment of our TRANSMISSIONS videos. There, you'll be able to see Phil Briones draw Liam and Nathanael from TWIN KINGS BATTLE. Cool, right?

Dear friends, 
As you may have understood it, we haven't reached our goal. While we're certainly disappointed, we're also very humbled and encouraged by your support and warm messages. There are many reasons why we didn't make the goal we set for ourselves: a very competitive environment (hundreds of other comics/graphic novel projects seeking funding at the same time we did), a COVID era that hurts our families greatly both on the human and financial fronts, not to mention a political situation in the US that sparks a lot of anxiety,  just to name a few.

This complete tarot contains 78 illustrated cards including 22 major and 56 minor arcana. Each card will be composed of an illustration and its name in english, with as reference the divinatory Tarot of Marseille. You will find a more detailed presentation of the cards in the ARCANA section of this page.
The format chosen for this tarot inspired by the Cthulhu Mythos (3.35" x 6.50"  | 85×165 mm) is much larger than the usual divinatory tarot decks, including the Tarot of Marseille. This format is close to one of the oldest tarot decks, the "Visconti-Sforza" created by the artist Bonifacio Bembo between 1428 and 1447. 
Given the large size of the cards, we have chosen a rather important weight (315 gr) which combines flexibility and rigidity. The R'lyeh edition silkscreen deck is printed on an OldMill Avorio paper (350 gr), which has a light cream tint, with a black silkscreen ink which allows a very deep rendering.
All decks will be delivered with a 64-page booklet (2,95" x 5,90" | 75x150 mm), printed in black and white (32 pages in English, 32 pages in French) that will help you with the interpretation of each card.
The Miskatonic and R'lyeh pledge tiers will also include Kickstarter exclusive components:
 160-page softcover book,
A black cotton drawstring bag (6.1" x 8.2" | 15,5x21 cm) with a red silkscreen print to store your deck,
 A magnetic box with hot stamping metal print,
 14 Fine Arts, printed in color on fine paper (6.1" x 8.2" | 26x14 cm),
 4 enamel Pins (size: 4,5 cm | 1.77"), featuring the 4 emblems of our Minor Arcana,
A limited edition of a 79-cards silk-screen printed deck (only in the R'lyeh edition). 
The softcover book is bigger and larger (4.8" x 6.2" | 12,2x15,7 cm) than the booklet included with the Deck. Its content is also very different: the  whole story of Isaac Jefferson's researches, interpretive poems, the iconography of each card fully explained as well as their links with the Myth. The book interior design is inspired from ancient books, illustrated with engravings and printed in two colors, black and a red pantone.
The soft-covered book will be available in English and French. You will be able select the language in the Pledge Manager after the campaign.
This is the standard Cthulhu Dark Arts Tarot deck. It will include:
 All 78 Tarot Cards + 1 Isaac Jefferson card printed in color,
 All Cards are improved with poker varnish,
All Cards are improved with black core quality,
All Cards are gilded with gold edges,
A 64-page booklet printed in black and white (32 pages in English and 32 pages in French. Size: 2,95" x 5,90" | 7,5x15 cm). This booklet will explain the symbolic meaning of each card,
PDF version of the booklet,
All these elements are packed in a tuck box finished with mat lamination.
The Miskatonic Pledge Tier will include all the rewards of the Innsmouth pledge Tier, plus Kickstarter exclusive elements:
 160-page softcover book (4.8" x 6.2" | 12,2x15,7 cm) containing more illustrations, texts and poems related to the Tarot deck and its story,
 14 Fine Arts, printed in color on fine paper (6.1" x 8.2" | 26x14 cm),

A black cotton drawstring bag (6.1" x 8.2" | 15,5x21 cm) with a red silk-screen print to store your deck when you are on the road,
A beautiful magnetic box with hot stamping metal print to store all the material of this edition.  
The R'lyeh Pledge Tier will include all the rewards of the Miskatonic Pledge Tier, plus:
 An extraspecial edition of the 79-cards deck, black silk-screen printed (Kickstarter exclusive),
This extra deck is packaged in its own tuck box,
The tray of the magnetic box will be adapted to contain this extra deck.
These extra cards will be silk-screen printed and hand crafted by "L'Atelier du Grand Chic", a French well known screen printer. The paper chosen by the artists and the craftsman is an Old Mill Avorio 350 gr, slightly tinted with a cream color and a sensitive grain.
The silk-print is a stencil based technic. It allows very intense color combined with a good opacity. This edition is very limited as it requires a lot of artistic and handmade work. The final rendering will be unique for each card!
You can get additional copies of the Innsmouth or Miskatonic editions by adding them to your pledge trough the add-ons section accessible by clicking on “Manage you pledge” button (explanation above). Man likes to mock the frenzied flutterings of the moth as it bumps around on the windowpane, its absurd craving for the indifferent and singeing surface of the lightbulb or the fire that will promptly incinerate it to utter cinders. But man should not laugh, for he ignores the reason of this mad convulsive flight; he ignores what the moth so desperately tries to flee, that which lies in the dark recesses of the world, betwixt the very fabric of time and space or the eldritch depths of our primitive consciousness…
One man knows. One man has been moth and flame, darkness and light and one man has learned their secrets, all their atavic mysteries engraved on a series of cards one millenium ago by a mad monk, a legacy of pain and dark epiphanies spawned in the roiling cosmos of long-dead corpse-stars. This man is Isaac S. Jefferson. And now this man wants you to inherit this burning and burderning knowledge.
Will you heed his call? Will you dare to delve into… the Cthulhu Dark Arts Tarot?
The illustrations of the Cthulhu Dark Arts Tarot were made by Førtifem. First entirely drawn by hand, each illustration was scanned and then colored using a computer. To ensure that the finished product would honor the quality of the illustrations as well as the greatness of the Cthulhu Mythos, we decided to print them on large cards (3.35" x 6.50" / 8,5×16,5 cm) on high quality paper (315 gr). The limited R'lyeh edition offers you a second deck, silkscreen printed in black.
This tarot contains the 22 major arcana present in the Tarot de Marseille. Each major arcana is composed of an illustration, a number and a name. You will find below a presentation of some major arcana taken from the game :
Each four figures is unique and pays homage to the universe of the Cthulhu Mythos. In each series, each face corresponds to an eldritch evolution of the previous one. Thus, the 4 figures placed side by side form a continuous illustration. Below, a representation of the faces of the suite of Pentacles and the suite of Cups.
Cthulhu Dark Arts Tarot contains 56 minor arcana, which include the numbers of the traditional tarot cards (Cups, Wands, Swords, Pentacles), while proposing illustrations reinterpreting them in the universe of Cthulhu. Contrary to the Rider-Waite Smith Tarot, the minor arcana - excluding figures - do not offer illustrations or characters, but rather a set of unique combinations of the tarot symbols: Cups, Wands, Swords... and Pentacles!
This deck was mainly created for the divination practice. The major and minor arcana correspond to those of the Tarot de Marseille, and you can use the Cthulhu Dark Arts Tarot in exactly the same way. All decks will be delivered with a 64-page booklet (32 pages in English, 32 pages in French) that will help you with the interpretation of each card.
The Miskatonic and R'lyeh editions will also include a 160-page softcover booklet. It contains information, from Isaac Jefferson's research, on how to interpret each card, with an interpretive poem, explanations on the iconography of the card.
Beyond divination, it is possible to use this deck in the practice of role-playing games of various types: tabletop role-playing in a universe similar to Cthulhu, LARP, murder party... Be creative, in order to add in your games elements of atmosphere allowing to immerse a little more your players in the horrific universe of Cthulhu.

We found it important to write this text, in order to recall the values that animate us. Passionate about imaginary cultures, we attach great importance and respect to the works created by H.P. Lovecraft, as well as to the works that helped develop the myth of Cthulhu. However, we also consider that this author’s views on race have no place in today’s society. We absolutely do not share these beliefs, and we have worked hard to recontextualize his creations to create an inclusive, fair and respectful project, consistent with our modern values.
We decided to present our projet on Kickstarter for two reasons. The first one is our will to reach the largest audience, to touch Cthulhu Mythos fans and tarot lovers around the world. But how to do this from Paris? Even for an established publisher in France, going international is a long road and we quickly found out that we had to break beyond the traditional channels. The second reason that convinced us, was the situation of our domestic market. Tarot decks you can find in French stores are very traditional and the usual actors of our market weren't ready yet to distribute a complete fancy and stylish tarot based on an imaginary world, even if this universe is called Cthulhu Mythos. It means that we definitively had to go online to offer this Tarot deck... And what better solution than Kickstarter, the world's largest funding platform for creative projects?
We are using local partners with logistic hubs in the European Union (Meeple Logistics), USA and Canada (Quartermaster Logistics), and Asia (VFI Asia), and we will also provide shipping for United Kingdom that is as friendly as possible. 
Backers will therefore benefit from optimized shipping costs and they won’t pay customs at package delivery as it is sent from their home country.
Through the pledge manager tool, after the campaign, backers will pay an amount corresponding to the shipping costs between the hub and their home. We take in charge transport to the hubs and potential custom fees.

Adrien Havet and Jesse Daubertes both started their careers as graphic designers, before devoting themselves as a duo to their shared love for illustrations, under one name.
Since 2012, they have developed a four handed style that borrows from the strength of tattoo lines as well as from the meticulousness of old engravings.
Swinging between dark and ultra colorful atmospheres, occultism and pop culture, they don't know how to do anything else but drawing, so they try to do it well.
Lovers of extreme musics, they share their time between creating visuals for bands (Rammstein, Slipknot, Trivium, Emperor, Alcest, Carpenter Brut...) but also for books and brands (HBO, Ubisoft, Cartier, Affligem, Le Monde...).
Their personal drawings have been exhibited in Paris, Los Angeles, and Hong Kong. They are based in Paris and work from home, with the "support" of their two feline bosses.

Maxime Le Dain is a 38 years old French representative of the translatoria editorialis species, a terrestrial parasite that dwells in the darkest recesses of publishing houses, waiting for a foreign author to fasten itself onto. Once its victim is hooked, the translatoria unfolds its long stinger to suck out of the writer's brain the ink it needs to survive, which it then spews back into another language. As of now, Maxime has had the honour of digesting the cerebral secretions of many wonderful artists, such as H.P. Lovecraft, Anthony Ryan, Joe Hill or Lewis Carroll. When saturated with ideas, the translatoria editorialis can enter a chrysalis state that enables it to autonomously excrete words and become itself an author. Maxime Le Dain currently lives in its nest in the French countryside, with its mate, two adorable pupae and three cats.
Founded in 2000, Bragelonne is the curious story of a bunch of friends who, rich of nothing but their passion for the genre, became in just a handful of years the first independent publishers of fantasy fiction books in French language.
Today, Bragelonne is referring more than 550 authors from all over the world and has published close to 6 000 titles, to form the most complete and diversified catalogue for fantasy fans of all ages with names such as David Gemmell, Raymond Feist, Pat Rothfuss, Peter Brett, Scott Lynch, Andrzej Sapkowski (The Witcher), Peter F. Hamilton, Richard Morgan (Altered Carbon), among many others; great classics of the genre such as Robert E. Howard, Howard P. Lovecraft or Arthur C. Clarke; Comics legends and new comers such as Joe Hill, Warren Ellis, Garth Ennis, Bryan Lee O’Maley… (for, why just novels when you can also do comics ?) Popular licences with D&D, Minecraft, Assassin’s Creed, TMNT, Rick & Morty to name but a few (would you believe we published a Time Story novel and the origin story behind The Werewolves of Miller’s Hollow ? would you ? well you should… cause we definityely did !); and last but not least, scores of original pieces of work born and bred in France such as Pierre Pevel, for instance, whose Cardinal's Blades trilogy has been published in 15 countries including the US of A or the UK... it’s the three musketeers with Dragons… what’s not to like ?
In 2019, Bragelonne’s honchos (Stéphane & Alain) having a mid life crisis of their own, decided to go back to what they enjoyed doing in the last century and created Bragelonne Games, signing the very same year an exclusive distribution deal with Gigamic (Hachette Boardgames). And for their 20th birthday, they were forced to play pandemic… a lot… like everyone else. Let’s all hope life will do less fumbles in the near future.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first Kickstarter campaign. As rookies, we knew that we needed support to propose a well-builded campaign and answer to backers expectations. That's why we decided to teamed with veterans as The Crowdfunding Agency who provide us great help and advises in this exciting first project. 

As leader in imaginary culture in our country we have a good knowledge of Cthulhu Mythos and H.P. Lovecraft works. We spent several months to build this project with Maxime Le Dain, a specialist in France who translated a lot of Lovecraftian stories to French. He had the hard task to imagine all arcana and link them to the Myth, wrote all their background and Isaac Jefferson story. The next step was to find a talented illustrator, able to mix and master ancient and modern styles and understand how deep is the Myth. We found this real gem with Førtifem who already had blown our mind with their several work for music industry. They are hard-workers and at the launch of this campaign, all cards, illustrations and colors, are finished and ready to print!

 Also as established publisher in France we have a good knowledge in printing games and books. Even if we control well this part, we have to be cautious on delivery date due to then COVID global pandemie as it can slow our workflow with partners, printers and logistics. 

The last challenge will be Brexit that can change the rules for our British friends at the end of this year. We don't know yet how it will impact the delivery of this Kickstarter but be sure that we want to provide shipping for United Kingdom that is as friendly as possible.

campaign.story:
Hello! My name is Jeana and this is my fourth Kickstarter Campaign! I recently designed a collection of aesthetic whale enamel pins that I hope to turn into crewnecks, lanyards, stickers and more! I’m very excited to run this Kickstarter and I hope you’ll enjoy them as well!
My previous Kickstarters were great successes with over CA$ 50,000 total pledged. Now, this new project will not only feature enamel pins and stickers, but also embroidered crewnecks, lanyards and washi tapes! However, I can't do so without your help. Supporting me through this Kickstarter will not only see these products be brought to life, but will also give you a greater discount! Any left over products will retail in my shop at a higher price.
Kickstarter has a pledge now and pay later mechanism, so that you will not be charged for your pledge until the end of the campaign and only if the initial goal is met. You can upgrade, downgrade, or cancel your pledge at any time before the campaign ends! Surveys will be sent at the end of the campaign through BackerKit to collect addresses and choose rewards.
For updates, future product designs, and more of my artwork and merchandise, check out my Shop and Instagram! Have a question? Check out the FAQs section of this campaign and if your question has not been answered, contact me via direct messages here or email me at jeanadraws@gmail.com
Scroll to the bottom of the page for more model photos!
 Please note that in the sample crewnecks, the sleeve was 1" longer. This will be adjusted to the new length in the size chart during mass production as the sleeves were too long in the samples. Sleeve designs will be mirrored on both sleeves (like the wave whale sample) and this will be adjusted during mass production for the sakura and dream whale crewnecks.
Lanyard samples
Each design set features an enamel pin, lanyard, vinyl sticker, and embroidered crewneck! The entire collection of products will unlock all at once as soon as the funding goal is met! The initial goal of CAD $2100 will go towards unlocking the Sakura Whale collection. Additional design collections are unlockable as stretch goals!
Each collection depicted above is also an overview to what is included in each bundle!
As a thank you for being a kickstarter backer and helping me bring this collection to life, I've decided to add a few freebies for you guys!
If you want to pledge for multiple different items, please pledge for the reward tier of the highest priced item, then increase the pledge amount by the cost of the additional items. 
 Please make sure you add your add-ons using the CAD prices! USD prices are just listed for reference. If you need any help with the calculations, don't hesitate to send me a message here and I'll gladly help you calculate your total :)
★ Please do NOT include any shipping costs in your pledge amount! Shipping costs will be calculated and charged via BackerKit after the campaign ends! ★
To change your pledge tier, click the the "Manage Your Pledge" button (at the top of the campaign page or by clicking your current reward tier). Then click the "Change your pledge" button and select "New reward tier".
To change your pledge amount, click the the "Manage Your Pledge" button (at the top of the campaign page or by clicking your current reward tier). Then click the "Change your pledge" button. Add your add-on total to the current pledge amount and it will update!
Please note that the above shipping prices are rough estimate and may be subject to change or fluctuate slightly, thank you for understanding! Shipping will be calculated based on your country and the weight of your package through BackerKit and you will be charged after the campaign is over.
Crewnecks/bundles will be packaged and shipped in a polybag (or box depending on number of crewnecks) via USPS Priority Mail (1-3 days), which also includes tracking.
Pin/lanyard/washi tape only orders will be packaged in a bubble mailer envelope and sent out via USPS First Class (3-5 days) and includes tracking. 
Sticker only orders will be shipped in a non-tracked envelope as letter mail.
For international backers, please note that you'll be responsible for any customs/VAT fees that may incur. It is illegal for me to change the price or mark the items as gifts on customs forms. If you do not accept the package and it is returned to me undamaged, I can refund you the costs minus shipping.
Due to the ongoing pandemic, shipping times cannot be 100% guaranteed, especially for international packages as many countries are experiencing a backlog and delay in accepting and delivering packages. Please ensure that your country is accepting packages around the time the products will be shipped! If you would like me to hold the package for you to be shipped at a later time, please let me know ASAP.
 This campaign will run for 3 weeks, after which there will be an additional 2-week period before I receive the funds from Kickstarter. Once the campaign is over, I'll send out surveys through BackerKit for everyone to choose their products and fill out shipping addresses. You'll have one week to fill out the survey and during this one week waiting period, the BackerKit preorder shop will also be available to everyone!
Once everyone has filled out the survey and I have a final count on the quantities I need to order, production for all the products will begin! Crewneck production should take less than 2 months, factoring shipping time to me, I expect to receive them in February. Once I receive everything, I'll quality check, package, and start shipping everything out to you guys! Current estimated delivery is March to early April!
Enamel pins, lanyards, washi tapes, and stickers may take less time to produce than the crewnecks so backers who only backed for those items may receive their packages earlier.
Please note that this is just a rough estimate of the timeline and that exact times may vary depending on number of backers, external situations and holidays, etc.
★ Early bird spots are limited to the first 48 hours, once you miss it, there will be no way of getting a spot again. If you un-pledge during the campaign you will not be able to re-pledge for early bird deals, even if someone else drops!
★ When you pledge on Kickstarter, you'll not be charged right away, so that you will not be charged for your pledge until the end of the campaign and only if the initial goal is met. If the campaign is unsuccessful, you will not be charged at all. You can upgrade, downgrade, or cancel your pledge at any time before the campaign ends!
★ Your pledges helps to unlock new designs, so even if the design that you like is still locked, your pledge can bring us one step closer to unlocking it. Please pledge for ALL of the items you'd like, even if they aren't unlocked yet! It helps us reach the next goal!
★ You can choose which product(s) you would like at the end of the campaign, after which I'll send out a BackerKit survey to collect your shipping address and the specific rewards you want to choose
★ Shipping is NOT included in the tier pricing! Shipping will be calculated and charged via BackerKit AFTER the campaign is over based on the weight of your package and your country. Please do not add any shipping costs to your pledge! Please see the shipping costs chart for an estimate of the shipping costs!
★ If you have any more questions, please don't hesitate to leave a comment, or you can email me at jeanadraws@gmail.com
See more of my products at www.jeanadraws.com!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've had experience running multiple kickstarter campaigns and have made various kinds of products including over 30 pin designs, keychains, washi tapes, lanyards, and more. I have reliable manufacturers for all my products that I use to ensure a smooth production process and quality products for you all.

Samples have been made for all three crewneck designs and will be made for the lanyards too before mass production to ensure the standard of quality. However, there still might be delays during production due to unforeseeable circumstances or slight alterations in color, size and design of the final production. These shall be minimal and not affect the overall appearance of the products. If the products must be remade, there will be a delay in shipping time. I will continue communicating with my manus and update you all on the process as we go along!

With the current COVID-19 pandemic, there is also a risk of your country not accepting packages if you're international and delayed shipping times (both domestic and international). In the case your country is not accepting packages when the products are ready to be shipped, I can hold the package until your country accepts packages again.

Note that refunds will not be issued under any circumstances once production has begun, as the funds go directly into production. By pledging, you understand and are willing to pay for both the items you pledge for and the subsequent shipping fees charged via BackerKit.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hi! My name is Rozenn, and I'm an illustrator from Lyon, France. I'm very excited to finally share this project with you!  
I have created a hand-painted Lenormand deck inspired by my deep love of nature and animals. Lenormand is a specific type of cartomancy, similar but different to the tarot you probably know from the Rider-Waite-Smith deck. While RWS has dense symbology and mysticism, Lenormand is more personal, direct, and simplistic. It feels almost conversational, and better suited for daily life. 
The Magpie's Lenormand is a 36-card deck printed on 400gsm art paper with matte finish. The cards are standard tarot size (4.72*2.75 in // 12*7 cm).
The deck features the complete set of 36 Lenormand cards, illustrated traditionally with ink paintings.
The back of the cards
The cards have metallic blue edge gilding
With many cards, the subject is a simple concept (example: The Dog, The Rider, The Clouds) that may feel similar to an Oracle deck, for those familiar with the idea. The deck has a very natural theme, focusing on plants and animals and insects. As such, the cards have been interpreted to fit, such as The House depicted as a gold-tinged beehive.
A few cards have been modified from the original "standard" Lenormand, including the Man and Woman cards. To avoid an unnecessarily limited binary, the Magpie's Lenormand instead has a run of The Caterpillar, The Chrysalid, and The Moth, including art that lines up into a nice scroll, showing this progression.
Each deck will come with The Magpie's Guide, a 48 pages full color booklet with a hard cover and delicate gold goiling. The Guide will be explaining symbolic meanings for each card. It is measuring 4.72*4.72in // 12*12cm with 135gsm paper and will be fully translated in English and French. Consider this booklet your guide. If you look upon the cards and are unsure what they mean, if no inclination or wisdom comes to you, you may use this to discern meaning. 
However, this guide is not law. If the cards have a clear meaning or message for you, what you see in them will always be more important and "correct" than what this booklet can tell you. To facilitate this, the booklet will even have some space left for you to contribute your own interpretations of the cards.  
We want to encourage people to read the cards from their own perspective, with some helping hands if needed. Follow your heart, and listen to your instincts.

◆ THE OUIJA BOARD ◆
The Ouija Board is a A5 art print (5,83*8,27in // 21*15cm) printed on 800gsm cardboard. It'll come with a Gold Enamel Planchette (1,5in // 40mm)
DISCLAIMER: We do not recommend to use this board to contact demons and other occult forces.

◆ THE MAGPIE'S BOX ◆
The Magpie's Box is a 5,83*8,27in // 21*15cm, 1,2in // 3cm high magnetic flip top box with delicate spot varnish decoration and embossing. The box is designed to house the deck, guide, ouija board, and planchette into a gorgeous object. It might be my favorite addition to our campaign and I love the simple yet lovely look of this packaging.
Hello, Arcturus here! I'm the guidebook writer and resident cartomancy nerd! I had the singular pleasure of watching Rozenn take my interpretations and turn them into beautiful realities.
When first approached for this project, I already knew Rozenn's work and their strengths; she's incredibly talented at soft, colorful nature and anatomy with a fine sense of detail work. So as we brainstormed for the deck, aligning traditional Lenormand with Rozenn's style, I tried to focus on the things I knew she could do well, honing the guidebook into that natural theme. 
Every card I got back was a delight. The ethereal fluffiness of The Clouds. The precise and careful beehive of The House. The frankly adorable Caterpillar. I have a lot of favorites in the deck, but I would probably pick The Snake and its subtle scaling as my absolute favorite.
Every card was hand-painted by hand with a lot of love, ink, and judicious application of bleach. Then, each was scanned into the computer for touch-ups, color correction, and typesetting. While I wrote the guidebook, Rozenn had plenty of say in the matter of how to depict every card, and in the modifications we made to make the deck ours. 
I think the holistic product is great and hope you do too!

◆ ORIGINALS & ART PRINTS ◆
Every card's original will be available with the Pledge Manager at the end of the campaign, alongside Art prints and every add-on of this campaign.
If you are a retailer and interested in the Magpies’ Box, then pledge 4 EUR to “A Blessing” and I will contact you after the campaign. If you have questions, please contact me with a KS personal message.
◆Important◆
I only work with brick and mortar stores or stores that are at least partially offline. 
Here you can see a short overview of the shipping costs for all pledge levels (€1.00 equals approximately $1.20). We have placed much effort into finding options to send everything to your home at a fair price. 
Important: You don't have to add these shipping prices on top of your pledge, Kickstarter will automatically do this for you.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If 2020 has shown anything, it's that a lot of unexpected things can come up. With that in mind, I have tried to minimize potential problems as much as possible before launching this campaign. All of the art is already completed. The booklet (Guide) is completed and translated. I'm in contact with a well-known manufacturer that has already produced several highly regarded Tarot/Lenormand decks (also for many Kickstarter campaigns). I have valid quotes for all components of this campaign and the same is true for shipping/fulfillment. I truly tried my very best to set everything up as precisely as possible for this project. 

This is my first Kickstarter technically, but I have been freelancing for other people's projects for many years and have seen them to completion. I have also consulted with people who have run very successful Kickstarters to keep my ideas realistic and achievable. 

The biggest risks for this campaign are definitely delays caused by the global pandemic and the corresponding daily changing state of the world. To minimize this risk as much as possible, I have been very careful with the time calculations and have built in a lot of buffers i.e. even if some things don't go as planned, this Kickstarter campaign should still be fulfilled on time. In case of any unforeseen problems (e.g. a lockdown for several months), I will inform all backers immediately and communicate transparently. In addition, I will also do my best to keep the influence of such disruptive factors as small as possible.

campaign.story:
After almost two years of illustrating epic scenes from the famous Latvian poem "Bearslayer", the book is finally ready to be published! Order your copy in advance by supporting our Kickstarter campaign and entertain yourself with one of the world's most monumental poems!
Nine hundred years ago, the German Crusaders were invading the Baltic region under the command of bishop Albert. The Council of the Latvian gods gathered. Under the protection of the Thunder God, Pērkons, they chose a noble warrior who would strive mightily against the forces of evil. This hero was Bearslayer, half man, half bear, the protector of nature and the Latvian people.
“Andrejs Pumpurs (1841–1902) published his epic poem Bearslayer (Lāčplēsis; 1888) against the backdrop of the political and economic monopoly of the German aristocracy, widely relying on Latvian folklore, mythology and historical material. (...) This folktale hero became a cornerstone of Latvian national identity at the time when Latvians were emerging as a modern nation, thus becoming one of the major foundation myths for the Republic of Latvia founded in 1918.” - KASPARS KĻAVIŅŠ
Bogdan Gărgăriță painting one of the illustrations for "Bearslayer"
My name is Bogdan Gărgăriță, the Romanian artist behind the illustrations of “Bearslayer”. While studying visual arts in Latvia, I became fascinated by their culture, art and architecture and soon decided to illustrate this influential epic poem. I immediately contacted Dr. Arthur Cropley, a renown Australian author, who wrote the only English translation in poetic form of the original Latvian poem, “Lāčplēsis”. He agreed on collaborating for this fantastic project.
Applying texture on the canvas
I painted decisive scenes on large canvases, using different techniques for creating the volumes of the decorations, with copper, silver and gold leaf to enrich the oil paintings. This ambitious project took me almost two years. The book is finished and ready for printing.
Painting details on the canvas
Applying silver leaf on canvas
 Here are some details of the large paintings Bogdan Gărgăriță made for Bearslayer.
"Bearslayer Meets Spīdala" - detail
"Bearslayer Conquers Demons and Raises the Sunken Castle" - detail
"The Midsummer's Eve Festival" - detail
"Pērkons Casts Lightning, Closing the Pit" - detail
"Bearslayer and the Black Knight fight to the Death" - detail
You can find more details of Bogdan Gărgăriță's paintings for Bearslayer at our update section.
Arthur Cropley
Author of the English version of "Bearslayer"
Dr. Arthur J. Cropley
Arthur Cropley was born in the remote desert township of Marree, South Australia, in 1935. The treeless desert landscape there could scarcely be more different from the forests of Latvia. Arthur graduated from the University of Adelaide (BA, DipEd), and after seven years as a school teacher in South Australia, England and Canada obtained his PhD in educational psychology from the University of Alberta (Canada) in 1965. He spent almost his entire academic career at the University of Regina (10 years), and the University of Hamburg (20 years). After retiring from Hamburg in 1998 he spent 12 years as a visiting professor at the University of Latvia in Riga. In 2005 he received an honorary doctorate from the University of Latvia and in 2008 was awarded the Order of the Three Stars by the president of Latvia for services to Latvian higher education. His proudest achievement is his translation of Lācplēsis into English epic poetry. In 2008 this work was honoured by the Latvian Academy of Science as an outstanding achievement of Latvian scholarship.

Bogdan Gărgăriță
Illustrator of "Bearslayer"
Bogdan Gărgăriță
Bogdan Gărgăriță is a painter, graphic artist and illustrator. He graduated from the Bucharest National University of Arts with a Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Arts and has a Master’s degree in Metal. In his final Master’s year, with the support of an Erasmus scholarship, he studied at the Art Academy of Latvia, in Riga, where he was fascinated by Latvian culture, art and architecture. Soon after this experience, illustrating Bearslayer came naturally. Bogdan is a member of the the Visual Artists’ Union of Romania with a rich portfolio in the artistic domain. He has had numerous exhibitions and has received awards in Romania and abroad. He has vast experience in painting and decorating on different supports such as canvas, wood and mural for several museums and locations in Romania. Bogdan also teaches drawing and heraldic painting to children in art schools and during summer camps and Medieval festivals. He has been illustrating books since 1997, and in 2017, together with Maria Poștea, he founded the Editura Intaglio Publishing House, where he publishes titles for children and adults.
"He soon grew angry with the Devil’s wit, / Cast lightning down and blocked the water’s track; / A hill with high steep slopes enclosed the pit- / Since then the peacock’s golden feet are black!"
"He swung his club with hate / Against each armoured head; / The men who felt its weight / With cloven helmet bled."
"But doglike teeth soon ripped / To shreds men fighting here. / Bearslayer firmly gripped, / And faced them with his spear."
"Bearslayer’s anger knew no bound: / He seized the Black Knight in his grasp; / Their deadly struggle shook the ground, / As now they fought to their last gasp."

Reasons to visit Riga - the hidden jewel of architecture
updates.update_content:
For the Romanian artist, Bogdan Gargarita, visiting Riga was a life changing experience. He visited the city of Riga for just a semester while studying for his Master's as an Erasmus student. While the visit was relatively short, the joy of his eyes remained with him and continued to influence his work years after.
Bearslayer is intended to be just one of the projects dedicated to the Latvian culture in Bogdan's future works. We invite you for a brief virtual visit to the magical city of Riga and encourage you to pay a visit as soon as traveling will be more suitable.

Dear backers and followers of our "Bearslayer" project,

The illustrations of Bearslayer are full of details, inspired by Latvian historical and traditional artifacts and pagan symbols. Here are a few examples from the Turaida Museum Reserve in Latvia, as well as Bogdan Gărgăriță's illustrations from Bearslayer:

updates.update_userinfo: Lāčplēša Diena / Bearslayer Day is Commemorated Today!
updates.update_content: Lāčplēsis Day marks the greatest victory in the history of the Latvian army. Every year, on November 11th, the Latvians pay tribute to their fallen soldiers who set out to defend the newly founded Latvian State in a War of Independence. The Latvian army had to fight the War of Independence in harsh and even hopeless conditions. Latvia was devastated, ravaged by outbreak of diseases and hunger. But the dream of free Latvia had been fulfilled. The Lāčplēsis Day is marked on the calendar as a commemoration day when tribute is paid to those who fought for Latvia’s freedom.

updates.update_userinfo: "Bearslayer", the Protector of Nature and his People + A Shout-Out to the Thrilling Campaign, The Book of Cults
updates.update_content: While studying in Riga, Bogdan was fascinated by the strong bond between the Latvian people and nature. You can always enjoy a lovely walk in the dense forests of Latvia. The love for nature is infused in the Latvian culture also by their epic poem, Bearslayer, as well as the folktales and legends that inspired it.

updates.update_userinfo: "Bearslayer" and the National Romanticism Movement in Latvia & Another Fantastic Project
updates.update_content: The epic poem, Bearslayer (Lāčplēsis), was created during the era of National Romanticism. In architecture, the National Romanticism, an Art Nouveau sub-style, has common elements with the epic poem, Lāčplēsis. It incorporates Latvian ethnic patterns and mythological figures with medieval roots. Bearslayer and National Romanticism both speak about the glorious Latvian history and the proud traditions of the Baltic people. We've made a digital collage of some National Romantic architectural details found in Riga, Latvia, combined with the illustrations of Bearslayer created by Bogdan Gărgăriță. His illustrations are influenced by this Latvian National Style and documented with historical elements to create a series of paintings in the Baltic spirit.
